content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.51 - Executive Order No. 51: Designating the Division of the Budget to coordinate the intergovernmental review of Federal programs. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, it is essential for the Federal government to
enlist the cooperation of State and local governments in evaluating, reviewing
and coordinating direct Federal developmental activities and federally assisted
programs and projects; and
WHEREAS, New York State has participated for more than a
decade through its State Clearinghouse in such a system of intergovernmental
consultation as prescribed for specified activities and programs by Circular
A-95 of the U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB), which had been issued
in 1969 to help effectuate two Federal statutes - section 204 of the

Demonstration Cities and Metropolitan Development Act of 1966 ( P.L. 89-754)
and section 401 of the Intergovernmental Cooperation Act of 1968 ( P.L. 90-577); and
WHEREAS, OMB Circular A-95 was rescinded effective

September 30, 1983, concurrent with the effective date of Presidential

Executive Order 12372 on "Intergovernmental Review of Federal Programs" (July
14, 1982), as amended by Presidential Executive Order 12416 (April 8, 1983); and
WHEREAS, this Presidential Executive Order directs Federal
agencies to provide opportunities for consultation by elected officials of

State and local governments directly affected by proposed Federal developmental
activities or financial assistance, and to be responsive to recommendations
emanating from a single point of contact within any state; and
WHEREAS, such order enables and encourages each state, in
consultation with its local elected officials and governments, to develop and
establish its own review mechanism through which both State and local
governments can monitor and influence such proposed Federal activities and
assistance; and
WHEREAS, to ensure the manageability and effectiveness of
the review process in New York State, county governments, or multi-county
planning organizations where they exist, should be utilized to the extent
practicable as representatives of local government for development and
implementation of the intergovernmental review of Federal programs in the

State; and
WHEREAS, the State Clearinghouse in the New York State

Division of the Budget, after consultation with local elected officials and the

State's regional planning boards, has developed a New York State

Intergovernmental Review Process that is consistent with the objectives of

Presidential Executive Order 12372, as amended by Presidential Executive Order
12416; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York: (1)

Do hereby
designate the New York State Intergovernmental Review Process as the official
mechanism through which New York State and its local governments can provide
commentary into Federal decisionmaking processes that determine the outcome of
proposed direct Federal developmental activities and proposed Federal
assistance for other programs and projects; and
(2)

Do further designate the Director of the

Budget or his designee as the required single point of contact for: (a) coordinating operation of the
aforementioned review process; (b) revising its procedures and scope of coverage from time to time, as may be
necessary, after further consultation with local governments; and
(c) transmitting all official recommendations
generated by such process to the appropriate Federal authorities. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: October 30, 1984
